wikipedia_page.main:
Percivale 'Percy' Campbell (26 December 1887 – 18 March 1960) was an English cricketer.  Campbell's batting and bowling styles are unknown, though it is known he occasionally fielded as a wicket-keeper.  He was born at West Ham, Essex.
Campbell made his first-class debut for Essex against Nottinghamshire at Trent Bridge in the 1911 County Championship.  He made twelve further first-class appearances for the county, the last of which came after World War I against Gloucestershire in the 1919 County Championship.  In his thirteen first-class appearances, Campbell scored 270 runs at an average of 14.21, with a high score of 35.He died at South Woodford, Essex, on 18 March 1960.
